citations.narrative:
A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review. A total of 298 guinea pigs were counted during this
inspection including adults, weanlings, and newborns. There were no inventory records of the number of adult guinea
pigs, weanlings, and newborns present in calendar year 2023 or records of animals that died this year.. Failure to
maintain these records can make it difficult to assess the health of caviary by identifying guinea pig losses by death or
decreasing numbers of animals born or animals kept for replacements. The licensee must maintain records on the
number of guinea pig held, owned, births, deaths and sold. Correct by July 27, 2023.

Space. Insufficient space was being provided to 77 weanling guinea pigs in 4 enclosures. Enclosures measure 36 inches
by 24 inches or 864 square inches of floor space. These 4 enclosures had 17, 18, 20, and 22 weanlings housed in 864
square inches of floor space. Weanling guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams require at least 60 square inches of floor
space. This size enclosure can not house more than 14 weanling guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams.
Inadequate space can cause stress and aggression in animals which can result in bites, scratches and other injuries from
fighting. Licensee must ensure that guinea pigs are provided with at least the minimum amount of floor space per animal
to prevent stress, aggression, and discomfort. Correct by July 24, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
